review_title: Cardiopulmonary coworker culture on night shift is toxic here.
job_title: Registered Respiratory Therapist in Burlington, NC
pros:
Nursing staff very helpful and overall friendly.
Tammy from education is a light in this Dept but not enough to endure the wrath of the night shift RT's
cons: 4 to 5 RT's on night shift at this facility are toxic and constantly chase away new staff members. I've been working in healthcare over 10 years now and have never seen such immature adults. This Dept is made up of people with the mentalities of High School Children which is why you have to post this position every 3-6 months!

review_title: Not enough staff for patient load
job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Burlington, NC
cons:
Ratio is 1 CNA per 14 patients the majority of the time

Management constantly changing

Management being unprofessional and gossiping about employees to OTHER employees

Supervisor can block your applications to other areas of the hospital or even system wide.

review_title: I learned a lot about the medical industry and about physician practices.  awesome experience.
job_title: Human Resources Representative in Burlington, NC
pros: I had the ability to make a difference in employees lives.  I pushed for higher compensation for entry level staff and was the HR person as we purchased practices and completed the onboarding process. Very rewarding.
cons: I don't know that i would call it a con but I believe in having an open presence to employees and management.  sometimes people would come to my office and hangout to talk.  I had to learn methods to get what they wanted to say and move them along so that I could work.

pros:
Time-off requests are accommodated. 
Aesthetically pleasing facility. 
A minority set of staff members to exemplify professionalism and compassion. 
Adequate parking.
cons:
Reputation amongst community is deplorable. 
Incompetent or lackadaisical trainers produce inadequate trainees. 
Staff members are oblivious to their habitual negligence of patients/clients. 
Little to no empathy for patients/clients largely based upon socioeconomic status and education level. 
Lack of competent staff. 
Lack of diversity.
Individuals in leadership roles with no proper relevant education and little to no relevant experience.
Cynical staff members must be encouraged to be more professional or consider other employment options. 
Staff members primary concern is to just get through a "shift" rather than leaving the workplace better than they found it.

job_title: Operating Room Orderly in Haw River, NC
pros: Weekend operating department staff are a pleasure to work with.
cons: Unable to always find work to advance your career because of low turnover.
